title: Yumurtatepe, Bitlis
text:
Yumurtatepe is a <a href="Villages%20of%20Turkey">village</a> in the <a href="Bitlis">Bitlis district</a> of <a href="Bitlis%20Province">Bitlis province</a> in Turkey. Formally, known as Papshen, Babshen, Papşin or Papşén. 
Before the deportations and genocide of the village's Armenian inhabitants, Babshen had a population of 325 individuals in 1909. Located to the village's west was Surp Harutyun church and to its East was a chapel named Lusabdugh Surp Sahak.
